title: Shyvana will be absolutely unfair with her new passive
body:
it is an extreme amount of extraneous power tied to an objective. This kind of idea has already proven to be either too strong or absolutely awful with no in-between {{champion:72}} {{champion:82}} ; why are you taking it a step further and giving her bonuses based on which dragon spawns? 

With 3 mountain drakes Shyvana can solo Baron and Elder drake with almost no damage taken, as well as being able to tear down turrets without minion waves. The 20% reduction from monsters via passive combined with the 30% bonus true damage to monsters makes her one of the strongest splitpushers. She will have some of the fastest objective-killing in the game, to boot. 

3 Infernals will have the same effect on her damage in teamfights; with 10% of her damage becoming true, she will shred through any champion even harder than she already does. 

Ocean giving her CDR will mess with builds and rune pages; especially an uneven number like 15. Something similar was tried with Cassiopeia's first rework and it proved to make her builds less flexible and more frustrating. It's not necessary.

Air Drake is the least offensive, but slow resistance is a powerful stat right now. 

tl;dr I'm surprised this passive is even being considered. Riot even knows that making her reliant on this would make her too feast or famine. But making her not NEED the buffs like she currently does just creates one of the strongest win-more mechanics in the game. At most, the bonuses should be very minor and utilitarian; these huge boons to objective-taking and damage potential are simply too much, and should NOT be her primary passive.

I think you're seriously overestimating the true damage buff. Any mention of true damage on a champion's kit kinda just sounds OP. But look at the numbers, say you have the 10% true damage conversion(and that's if you get 3 Infernal drakes), your autoattack damage is 150, and the target has 100 armor. 100 armor reduces physical damage by half.

Without the buff: 
150/2 = 75 
With the buff you're doing 135 physical damage plus 15 true damage, so:
135/2 + 15 = 82
That's it, 82 damage instead of 75. 
If you have just one Infernal, you're doing 79 instead of 75 damage.

Does that sound broken to you? If anything I'd say it needs a buff.

> They're the two CDR items that Shyv will build. I imagine she'll go for the former when she kills Ocean Drakes. Otherwise, she won't go for CDR heavy builds, much less include them in her runes.

Fair enough, I guess. Many champs have CDR overkill issues at the moment, but it would be generally a waste on Shyv, probably.

> Objectives are the most dynamic part of the game. Controlling them factors in warding, power spikes, positioning and minion waves. Why wouldn't you double down on that?

Pretty much for this reasoning exactly. They are an important factor in the game. And you build overkill on those, you get champions like Skarner and items like Ohmwrecker. Skarner is a perfectly capable champion in his own right without his energy spires, and the addition of those bring him up to an overboard state in some cases, until you learn to avoid his spires. Then he's simply zoning the map, but not truly tearing up the enemy team alone, so he appears to be healthy. It's throwing off players' playstyles to the point that counterplay measures are not accurately shown by game data. He has the second-highest win-rate while also maintaining some of the lowest damage dealt, damage taken, and kill amounts in the game. In Shyv's case, game data will probably give insight to the situation, as every Shyv will be a ward-master and secure every possible dragon, but the global effect is still immense with this passive change.

Ohmwrecker, similarly, is absolute junk because it's meant to be an assassination item, but not meant to be overly abusive, and therefore simply open an enemy's tower for a few seconds, but give no damage to the gankers. Therefore, nobody wants to go for this early, not until they amass some damage. However, if they don't go for it early, the only general options are ever going to be go for it while snowballed ahead, or get it while the enemy is snowballed, where once again, the effects are abysmal. So, in short, the item is only viable in a short window early in the game, but will hold back your damage in that part of the game, and hold back your effectiveness. Similarly, Shyv won't feel a single effect from these dragons until she's already sauced a boatload with her allies on a few dragons. She'll get the buff when she doesn't need it to win, and she'll find it impossible to get when she needs it the most. That's the biggest problem.

> This sounds to me like: "don't let his team get towers, don't let him get farm". I mean, yeah, it'd work but it's an impossible demand.

Well, impossible in some games, possible or even probable in others, like Shyvana's proposed passives, which is exactly what OP was saying.

> You are describing any champion with an ultimate here.

No, I'm talking about game field manipulation specifically, specifying that Shyv's/Morde's/Skarner's are a manipulation on a non-stable game factor, such as dragon presence and recharge times on spires, and similar to unit hop abilities, only the unit-hops are in a much more stable game factor, that being the locations of live units to hop to. Ultimates in general are not such manipulation abilities.

> which makes this untrue [that an ability would be forced to be buffed substancially].

It is true. If a unit finds problems making reliable use out of their fenced area, like Skarner, that gets beefed into abusiveness, such as Skarner getting up to 120% MS, 160% AS, and 2% max mana regen *without duration* while in range of an active Spire. That is some crazy beef, and is only allowed because Riot assumes smart players will stay out of Skarner's area, so they can let him be crazy imposing. They don't note that the zone effect from this can be a conditional thing from game to game, and cause the game to snowball his direction quite consistently.

> Yes. The game is centered around bot lane.

It would be if Shyvana was getting all her useful buffs there... I wouldn't gank top until I knew their jungler was leagues away from that dragon, and even then, I'd probably take it. I doubt anyone would do any different, because top simply isn't worth it when the benefits stack so high, hence seasons 4-5 and the seasons of top seclusion and no rift herald.
